tertiary.title: University of Edinburgh
bulletPoints: I graduated with First Class Honours while sitting for Masters of Engineering. Upon graduation I placed third in my year.
A multi-faceted course combining various aspects of Civil, Chemical, Fire Safety and Structural Engineering with Architectural History and Theory.
I decided to specilise in Structural and Fire safety engineering. The balance of mathematical challenge and creative problem solving most closely matched to my skillset over pure Architecture.
My thesis on ‚ÄúHybrid Reinforced Concrete under Fire Conditions‚Äù was published in a Professional Engineer Journal.

aboutSite.title: About this site
paragraph: The site has been created to showcase my technical skill set. I hope this has been conveyed from an end-user‚Äôs perspective and through analysis of the underlying source code üî¨.
I aimed to build a responsive site, with special attention placed on load times and accessibility. Please see links to the source code in the footer.
If you like what you see, feel free to drop me a message on LinkedIn!

techStack.title: Tech stack
paragraph: This site is built with React ‚öõÔ∏è and Gatsby üçæ, using styled components from Emotion üë©‚Äçüé§.
React is a Javascript library maintained by Facebook that is used for constructing user interfaces.
Gatsby is a React-based static site generator. This, alongside code splitting, intelligent image loading and asset optimisation leads to incredibly fast page loading times.
Emotion is a library designed for writing CSS in JavaScript. This removes the need for a global style-sheet and allows for co-location of style nearer to where it used.
I have created a 'Atomic Hierarchy' to aid abstraction and reuse throughout the application. In the future this Component Library may be published in a open-source NPM repository.
All code (apart from React/Gatsby/Emotion dependencies) is my own and has been written from scratch.
